title: 10-minute delivery: The cost of convenience and what happens when discounts vanish
content: Quick commerce platforms like Swiggy Instamart and Blinkit are facing consumer pushback due to rising fees, including handling, delivery, and surge charges. This is prompting shoppers to compare prices with local vendors and plan purchases to avoid extra costs.

title: 'They asked me to raze house': PMAY glitch forces 80 y/o widow to live under tree
content: Gaura Bai, an 80-year-old widow from Madhya Pradesh, faces homelessness due to a software glitch in the PM Awas Yojna. After being instructed to demolish her mud house in anticipation of a new one, she and her family have been living under a tree for ten months.

title: Bilawal Bhutto's extradition 'offer': Hafiz Saeed‚Äôs son fumes; LeT lashes out
content: Bilawal Bhutto's offer to extradite Pakistani terrorists to India has sparked outrage, particularly from Talha Saeed, son of Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Saeed. Talha condemned Bhutto's remarks as an "irresponsible offer," demanding instead the extradition of Indian leaders and accusing Bhutto's family of aligning with Western and Indian narratives against Pakistan.

title: IND v ENG: 'I'd be worried ...': Broad's stern warning for England ahead of Lord's Test
content: India secured a massive win against England, leveling the series 1-1. The third Test shifts to Lord's. Stuart Broad highlights India's potent bowling attack, especially with Jasprit Bumrah's return. Shubman Gill's team is confident after their Edgbaston triumph. England focuses on strengthening their pace options. All eyes are on how England will counter India's revitalized pace attack.

title: Telangana factory tragedy: Toll rises to 42 at Sigachi; 8 still missing
content: The Sigachi Industries blast death toll has tragically climbed to 42 with the passing of Jitendra Kumar and the identification of Chikkan Singh through DNA analysis. Eight individuals remain missing following the devastating incident. Out of the 33 initially injured, 14 have been discharged, while 18 are still receiving medical care in various city hospitals, as confirmed by Sigachi Industries.

title: GitHub CEO: 'Smartest' firms will hire more software engineers, not fewer
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke suggests that companies leveraging AI effectively will increase developer hiring to capitalize on AI-driven productivity gains. He argues AI serves as a multiplier for engineering talent, making developers more efficient and creating demand for skilled professionals. Dohmke dismisses the idea that AI alone can build successful businesses without substantial coding knowledge.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Be in love with the grind': Gill's post sums up India's historic win
content: Shubman Gill's stellar batting performance, including becoming the first batter to score 250 and 150 in the same match, and Akash Deep's 10-wicket haul powered India to a record-breaking 336-run victory over England at Edgbaston. Gill's captaincy debut marked India's first win at the venue since 1967, leveling the series 1-1.

title: Airlines alarmed by DCGA's new medical test rule for pilots
content: India's DGCA has mandated that commercial pilots undergo medical tests exclusively at Indian Air Force centers, raising concerns among airlines. This decision, prompted by a cardiac arrest incident, aims to prevent falsified medical records.

title: Infosys HR notice: IT giant sends 'detailed warning email' to employees
content: Infosys is sending personalized warnings to employees exceeding standard work hours, a move contrasting founder Narayana Murthy's call for a 70-hour workweek. The company's automated system tracks remote work, alerting employees working beyond 9 hours and 15 minutes daily. This policy shift prioritizes employee well-being and work-life balance amidst health concerns in the IT sector.

title: Bihar voter list row: Oppn vs EC intensifies; SC to hear pleas against SIR
content: The Supreme Court has agreed to an early hearing on petitions challenging the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, scheduled for Thursday. Opposition parties RJD and Congress, along with the Association for Democratic Reforms, argue the revision could disenfranchise lakhs, particularly marginalized communities, due to strict citizenship documentation requirements within a short timeframe.

title: Maha security scare: Suspicious boat spotted off Raigad coast; cops on alert
content: Coastal security in Maharashtra's Raigad district is on high alert after a suspicious boat with possible foreign markings was spotted near Revdanda coast. The Navy, Coast Guard, and local police have launched a joint operation. Adverse weather conditions are hindering efforts to reach the vessel, prompting heightened security measures across the district.

title: Tesla board urged to question Eleon Musk by former DOGE adviser
content: Former DOGE advisor James Fishback is critical of Elon Musk's decision to form the America Party, citing concerns about Musk's focus on Tesla. Fishback's firm, Azoria Partners, has postponed the launch of its Tesla ETF due to potential conflicts with Musk's CEO responsibilities. US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent also suggested Musk should prioritize his companies over political endeavors.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Deserves that smile' - Shastri lauds Gambhir as India's bold call pays off
content: Ravi Shastri questioned resting Jasprit Bumrah for the Edgbaston Test, but India's bowlers, led by Akash Deep and Mohammed Siraj, secured a historic win. Gautam Gambhir's team management saw their bold selection calls vindicated as India leveled the series 1-1. Shubman Gill praised Akash Deep's performance, confirming Bumrah's return for the Lord's Test.

title: Bank holiday for Muharram 2025: Are banks open or closed today?
content: Bank Holiday for Muharram 2025: There was uncertainty about banking services on July 7, 2025, due to confusion over the Muharram holiday. The official government calendar stated Muharram was on July 6, 2025. Therefore, banks are open on July 7.

title: Mars in just 15 years? European Space Agency‚Äôs bold plan
content: The European Space Agency (ESA) has revealed an ambitious plan to establish human settlements on Mars within 15 years. ESA's vision includes self-sustaining habitats, AI-driven farming, and in-space manufacturing, aiming to create a solar system economy. While challenges remain, ESA believes collaboration and technological advancements could make this multi-planetary dream a reality by 2040.

title: Russell Wilson‚Äôs wife Ciara celebrates his Marvel debut
content: Ciara supports Russell Wilson as his clothing label, 3BRAND, appears in Marvel's Ironheart. The brand made its TV debut in the Disney+ series. Wilson shared his excitement on social media. Ciara also expressed her pride. 3BRAND's appearance raises its profile in fashion and entertainment. The couple's business bond continues to grow. Their influence has now reached a global superhero stage.

title: NBA trade buzz: Warriors eye $27M Heat star; Kuminga key in deal?
content: Jonathan Kuminga's future with the Golden State Warriors is uncertain as trade rumors swirl. He's expected to meet with interested teams in Las Vegas amid speculation of a potential deal. The Miami Heat are a possible destination, with discussions involving a sign-and-trade for Kyle Anderson, aiming to bolster both teams with strategic additions and future assets.

title: Was Yung Miami warning Cardi B the whole time? Stefon Diggs drama explodes online
content: Cardi B has removed all traces of Stefon Diggs from her Instagram account. This action has fueled speculation about a breakup. Fans are recalling a past warning from Yung Miami. Miami had previously labeled Diggs a "hoe" in a tweet. This tweet is now seen as a warning to Cardi B. Cardi B and Diggs were rumored to be dating. Fans believe Cardi B ignored red flags. The internet is buzzing with theories about the split. Some suggest Diggs was a rebound after Offset. The situation remains unconfirmed. Fans are closely watching for further developments.

title: 'Any country aligning with anti-American policies of Brics ... ': Trump's warning
content: Donald Trump threatened Brics nations with an additional 10% tariff for aligning with what he termed "anti-American policies," following India's signing of a Brics declaration condemning US tariff measures. He announced the delivery of tariff letters to various countries and previously threatened 100% tariffs if Brics moved to replace the US dollar.

title: Gold rate outlook for July 7, 2025 week - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices may fluctuate due to US tariff policies and trade deal uncertainties. The July 9 deadline and potential tariffs on BRICS nations are key factors. Easing US-China trade tensions and a possible Iran-Israel ceasefire have impacted gold's safe-haven appeal.

title: Karnataka NEET UG Counselling 2025 starts: KEA opens roll number enrollment
content: The Karnataka Examinations Authority (KEA) has begun roll number enrollment for NEET UG 2025 counselling, a key requirement for state quota admissions in medical, dental, and AYUSH courses. Candidates must complete the process by 11 am on July 8. Fresh applicants can register from July 7 to 10, with verification details to be announced separately.

title: Kolkata rape: 18 witnesses, bedsheet, DNA; 'enough evidence for water-tight case'
content: Kolkata police, investigating the law college gang-rape case, believe they have sufficient evidence for a strong case and plan to request an extension of police custody for the four accused. Investigators have recorded 18 witness testimonies, reconstructed the crime scene, and seized key physical evidence, including DNA samples and CCTV footage.

title: WATCH: Kaat de? MS Dhoni seeks permission before cutting cake on birthday
content: MS Dhoni celebrated his 44th birthday in Ranchi, a video capturing him politely seeking permission before cutting his cake went viral. Dhoni's illustrious career includes leading India to victory in the 2011 Cricket World Cup and the 2013 Champions Trophy. He also captained India in the 2007 ICC T20 World Cup.

title: Espionage accused Jyoti Malhotra visited Kerala on official invitation, reveals RTI
content: Jyoti Malhotra, a vlogger arrested for espionage, had previously been invited to Kerala as part of a tourism promotion initiative. The Kerala tourism department covered her expenses during visits to various cities. Kerala's tourism minister denies knowingly inviting individuals involved in espionage, dismissing allegations from a BJP leader regarding Malhotra's invitation.

title: 'Fake narrative': Professor guided Pune woman on false rape complaint
content: Pune's police commissioner refuted claims of deteriorating law and order after a woman's rape complaint was found to be false and misleading. Investigations revealed inconsistencies in her account, including a consensual encounter and a self-authored threat message. The woman, an IT professional, has been referred to counselling, and a professor who advised her is also being questioned.

title: Parag Tyagi refutes rumours about dog Simba‚Äôs health after Shefali's demise
content: Following Shefali Jariwala's death, concerns arose about her pet Simba's well-being. Her husband, Parag Tyagi, shared a video assuring everyone that Simba is healthy and participating in post-death rituals. Parag and Simba were seen distributing food to the needy, seeking blessings.

title: Suicide or murder? DOJ, FBI drop big update on Jeffrey Epstein death
content: A DOJ and FBI memo concludes Jeffrey Epstein's death was a suicide, dismissing murder and blackmail conspiracy theories. Investigators found no evidence of a client list or blackmailing of powerful figures. The administration is releasing enhanced video footage from Epstein's prison cell to support the suicide conclusion, aiming to dispel widespread online speculation.

title: Manish Sisodia, Satyendar Jain, Vijay Nair: The new 'power centres' of Punjab AAP
content: Following AAP's defeat in Delhi, the party's central leadership is focusing on Punjab, its only governed state. Senior leaders Manish Sisodia and Satyendra Jain are now overseeing key portfolios, leading to concerns about Delhi's influence and rising corruption. The BJP criticizes this "outsourcing" of governance, while AAP defends it as guidance for the benefit of Punjab.

title: Brics backs India line on Pahalgam & UNSC reforms, slams tariffs
content: The Brics summit in Rio saw strong condemnation of the Pahalgam terrorist attack. Member nations urged concerted action against UN-designated terrorists. They also supported comprehensive reform of the UN Security Council. India joined Brics in criticizing attacks on Iran. The declaration expressed grave concern about the situation in the Occupied Palestinian territory.

title: UAE Golden Visa: How Indians can now get lifetime residency without investment
content: The UAE has introduced a nomination-based Golden Visa for Indians, offering lifetime residency for a one-time fee of AED 1,00,000, eliminating the need for property or business investment. This new model targets individuals with valuable professional backgrounds or societal contributions. Applications are managed through Rayad Group, with traditional investment and merit-based routes remaining available.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Essence of game ... ' - Gill slams Dukes ball, flat pitches
content: Shubman Gill, despite his stellar batting performance in the series with nearly 600 runs, has expressed concerns about the deteriorating quality of the Dukes ball and the unresponsive nature of English pitches. He highlighted the challenges bowlers face due to the ball losing shape quickly, impacting strategic depth and competitiveness in Test cricket.

title: 200-year ritual: In MP, tazias ‚Äòpay salami‚Äô to Lord Krishna; Karbala journey follows
content: In a remarkable display of communal harmony in Madhya Pradesh's Bhander town, Muharram tazias, carried by the Muslim community, paused to pay respects to Lord Krishna at the 200-year-old Chaturbhuj Krishna temple before proceeding to Karbala. This tradition stems from the temple's construction by a Muslim family, the Hazari family, who also donated land.

title: 'Kantara' Ch1' poster unveiled on Rishab Shetty‚Äôs birthday, release announced
content: On Rishab Shetty's birthday, the makers of 'Kantara' unveiled a fiery new poster for the prequel, 'Kantara: Chapter 1,' set to release on October 2, 2025. The poster depicts Shetty in a primal battle stance, hinting at the film's exploration of the legend's origins and deeper dive into folklore. Following the success of the original, the prequel promises an immersive cinematic experience.

title: People with THIS blood type face a higher risk of early-onset stroke
content: A recent study reveals a potential link between blood type and the risk of early-onset stroke. Researchers found that individuals with blood type A may have a slightly elevated risk, while those with blood type O may have a lower risk. Further research is needed to understand the underlying mechanisms and develop targeted prevention strategies.

title: Deadly stunt for reel: 12-year-old lies on track under passing train in Odisha;
content: A shocking video surfaced showing a 12-year-old boy performing a dangerous stunt on railway tracks in Boudh district, lying down as a train passed over him. The Railway Protection Force (RPF) has registered a case against him and a 15-year-old friend who filmed the incident.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex below 83,400
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Monday on global uncertainty regarding US President Donald Trump‚Äôs tariff policies.

title: AP EAMCET 2025 counselling begins on this date: Check complete schedule
content: APSCHE will commence the AP EAPCET 2025 counselling for MPC stream candidates on July 7, initiating registration, document verification, and web options entry. Candidates who qualified must meet eligibility criteria, including minimum marks in 10+2 with relevant subjects. Required documents include rank card, memos, and certificates, with online registration and fee payment via the official portal.

title: Edgbaston breached: India break duck in England‚Äôs storied fortress, win by 336 runs
content: Under gloomy skies, India's youthful team triumphed over England by 336 runs in the second Test at Edgbaston, securing their first-ever win at the venue. Led by Shubman Gill, with stellar performances from Gill himself and Akash Deep, India proved their mettle despite missing key players like Bumrah and Kohli.

title: IND v ENG: 'Not many better feelings in cricket' - DK lauds India after Edgbaston win
content: India's resounding 336-run victory over England at Edgbaston, leveling the series 1-1, drew praise from cricket pundits. Akash Deep's stellar 10-wicket match haul, stepping in for Bumrah, fueled India's triumph. Shubman Gill etched his name in history with scores of 269 and 161. Atherton acknowledged India's dominance, highlighting the psychological impact of winning without Bumrah.

title: Mini India-US trade deal likely soon, some sectors may be excluded
content: India and the United States are nearing a mini trade deal, excluding sensitive sectors like dairy and agriculture for now. Discussions are ongoing to finalize the deal before the July 9 tariff suspension deadline. India seeks the removal of the 26% tariff.

title: '100-year catastrophe': Over 80 killed in Texas flash floods - What we know so far
content: Devastating flash floods in Texas have resulted in at least 82 fatalities and numerous missing individuals, including children, during the Fourth of July holiday. President Trump declared it a "100-year catastrophe" and plans to visit the affected areas. Rescue efforts are intensifying as forecasters predict more heavy rain, with officials warning of a rising death toll across the flood-stricken state.

title: 'Never heard of it': Musk‚Äôs swipe at Trump‚Äôs ‚ÄòAmerica Party‚Äô rant on Truth Social
content: Elon Musk's dismissive "What's Truth Social?" remark ignited a feud with Donald Trump, who criticized Musk as a "train wreck" and denounced his "America Party." Netizens swiftly countered Musk's claim, unearthing past posts where he referenced Trump's platform. This exchange highlights the escalating tension between the former allies.

title: IND vs ENG: Jasprit Bumrah hilariously trolls Shubman Gill ‚Äì WATCH
content: Jasprit Bumrah, sidelined for workload management during the second Test at Edgbaston, playfully trolled captain Shubman Gill about his bowling performance during the 2023 ODI World Cup match against the Netherlands. Bumrah humorously suggested Gill was 'banned' after that spell.

title: Sloppy USMNT performances to blame as U.S. loses yet another Gold Cup final to Mexico
content: The USMNT's first chance to win a trophy under coach Mauricio Pochettino slipped away as it played poorly against Mexico in the Gold Cup final.

title: Nats seek 'fresh approach,' fire Martinez, Rizzo
content: Headed into an off day and stuck in last place in the NL East, the Washington Nationals fired manager Dave Martinez and general manager Mike Rizzo on Sunday night, hours after a 6-4 loss at home completed a sweep by the Boston Red Sox.

title: Durant to Rockets part of NBA-first 7-team trade
content: A series of moves going back to Kevin Durant's trade to the Houston Rockets before the draft ultimately became the first seven-team trade in NBA history.

title: Poch: USMNT Gold Cup lessons 'priceless, painful'
content: United States coach Maurico Pochettino said his team had learned "priceless" lessons despite a "painful" 2-1 loss to rival Mexico during Sunday's Gold Cup final.

title: Rollins agrees to 3-year deal to return to Bucks
content: Free agent guard Ryan Rollins has agreed to a three-year, $12 million deal to return to the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: Kershaw gets special ASG invite; no Soto, Betts
content: The MLB All-Star Game rosters will feature 19 first-timers -- and special commissioner's pick Clayton Kershaw -- as the pitchers and reserves were announced Sunday.

title: Sources: Nuggets expect Valanciunas to honor deal
content: The Denver Nuggets have informed Jonas Valanciunas ' representatives that the franchise fully expects the center to honor his contract, sources said.

title: Two-time champ Alonso declines HR Derby invite
content: Two-time champ Pete Alonso of the Mets told reporters Sunday that he will skip the Home Run Derby in Atlanta, adding, "I have never really fully enjoyed the three off days, so I just want to be in the best possible position to help this team win."

title: Pirates CF Cruz makes 105.2 mph throw to plate
content: Pirates center fielder Oneil Cruz made a 105.2 mph throw to nab Seattle's J.P. Crawford at the plate on Sunday, the second-hardest thrown ball to produce an outfield assist since Statcast started tracking in 2015.

title: üèà Fantasy football sleepers, busts and breakouts
content: Which players will surprise, disappoint or make a big jump this fantasy season? Our analysts give their picks.

title: All-Star rosters: Biggest snubs and other takeaways
content: Some of the game's biggest names are headed to Atlanta, but some deserving stars will be watching from home.

title: The most obscure MLB All-Stars ever
content: Hunter Goodman just became an All-Star -- not the first time an unfamiliar player is headed to Midsummer Classic.

title: What Nationals' overhaul means for their No. 1 draft pick and trade deadline plans
content: Washington fired its GM and manager as draft and trade season heat up. Here's how the fallout could play out.

title: Remembering Ruffian 50 years after her breakdown at Belmont
content: The filly shattered her right front ankle in a match race against Kentucky Derby winner Foolish Pleasure.

title: First-half MVPs for all 30 MLB teams
content: The stars (and storylines) so far, plus how each club's playoff hopes have risen -- or fallen -- this past month.

title: After a week of upsets, which Americans are still playing at Wimbledon?
content: Wimbledon has been brutal for the top seeds, but Ben Shelton and Emma Navarro are among those who remain in the draw

title: Los Angeles Sparks troll Sophie Cunningham's comments on Detroit, Cleveland after win
content: Earlier in the week, the Indiana Fever guard said she didn't know how excited players would be to play in two of the WNBA's three latest expansion cities.

title: Three rookies, five first-time honorees highlight All-Star roster
content: Indiana and Seattle each put three players on the All-Star Game roster, which also includes a trio of rookies.

title: USC Paralympian Ezra Frech is a pioneer under pressure
content: The two-time gold medalist is the first above-the-knee amputee recruited to a D-I track and field program.

title: Lando Norris on British GP final lap: Don't mess it up
content: As Lando Norris closed in on home victory at the British Grand Prix, he had one overriding thought in his head: "Just don't f--- it up."

title: Musiala fractures left leg in Donnarumma collision
content: Bayern Munich said Jamal Musiala faces a "lengthy" recovery from a left leg fracture after his collision with PSG goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma.

title: Mart√≠n Zubimendi joins Arsenal from Sociedad
content: Arsenal have completed the signing of highly rated Spain midfielder Mart√≠n Zubimendi from Real Sociedad, the Premier League club have announced.

title: Spain on favourites tag: 'Don't mention that word'
content: Spain defender Olga Carmona said there is no mention of the word favourites as they prepare to face Belgium in the European Championship on Monday.

title: Norway on brink of Euros QF after Finland win
content: A late solo strike by Norway forward Caroline Graham Hansen secured a 2-1 victory against Finland in the Women's European Championship on Sunday, as the twice champions took a big step towards qualifying for the quarterfinals.

title: Neuer criticizes Donnarumma after Musiala injury
content: Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer criticized his PSG counterpart Gianluigi Donnarumma after Jamal Musiala suffered an apparent serious injury.

title: Santi hopes to 'make fun' of Pulisic after GC final
content: Mexico striker Santiago Gimenez has plenty of motivation going into Sunday's Gold Cup final against the United States.

title: Madrid's Gonzalo living a 'dream' at CWC
content: Real Madrid forward Gonzalo Garc√≠a said he is a living a "dream" at the FIFA Club World Cup after earning comparisons to the club's legendary former striker, Raul, with four goals in five games for Los Blancos.

title: Gonzalo Garc√≠a proves he can be the reason Real Madrid win Club World Cup
content: With Real Madrid in the semifinals of the Club World Cup, the performances from youngster Gonzalo Garc√≠a could be the reason they go all the way.

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Hosts Switzerland keep knockout hopes alive
content: Switzerland's win over Iceland has them on course for the knockouts. Here's what else you need to know from Euro 2025 action.

title: From New York to Michigan: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 2 quiz
content: You say you're a fan, but how well do you know your state sports trivia? Cue our second "state check" of the summer.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona told price to sign Rafael Le√£o
content: Barcelona have been told what they will need to pay to sign Rafael Le√£o from AC Milan. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window weekly: Gy√∂keres close to Arsenal? Chelsea, City to trim squad?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Meet the 2026 recruits who remind us of some big NBA players
content: Projecting high school talent isn't an exact science, but it's easier when they remind us of NBA stars at that age.

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Supreme Court Refuses Interim Stay On Election Body's Bihar Roll Revision
content: The Supreme Court will hear on Thursday the challenge against the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the voter list in poll-bound Bihar. The court accepted the petitioners' request for an urgent hearing in the matter.

title: Karnataka Lorry Owners Halt Food Grain Transportation Over Unpaid Dues
content: The Federation of Karnataka State Lorry Owners and Agents' Association has announced a complete halt in the transportation of rice and food grains meant for the Anna Bhagya scheme as a protest against the non-payment of previous dues.

title: All About UAE's New Golden Visa For Indians: Eligibility, Perks And More
content: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has made the 10-year residency more accessible to professionals across sectors.

title: 15 Tamil Nadu Fishermen Return From Iran, Efforts On To Rescue Others
content: A group of 15 Tamil Nadu fishermen who were stranded in Iran following the Iran-Israel war have returned safely to Chennai.

title: "Eat 5 Star, Do Nothing": DMK Mocks Palaniswami On World Chocolate Day
content: In a sharp political jibe, the DMK on Monday took aim at AIADMK General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami through a satirical social media post captioned, "Eat 5 Star, Do Nothing."

title: Covid Hospitalisation, Family History, Lifestyle Linked To Sudden Deaths: Study
content: Hospitalisations due to severe Covid-19 infection, a family history of sudden deaths, as well as lifestyle behaviours are some of the reasons behind the unexplained sudden death, according to study.

title: Ghaziabad Woman Thrashes Mother-In-Law, Drags Her While Mother Films
content: A young woman, Akanksha, was seen thrashing and dragging her mother-in-law down the staircase at their Ghaziabad home.

title: Nitin Gadkari Flags 'World War' Threat Citing Israel-Iran, Russia-Ukraine
content: Coordination, harmony and love are vanishing due to the authoritarianism and dictatorship of superpowers and there is an atmosphere of conflict across the world, Union minister Nitin Gadkari said on Sunday.

title: "This Is Aura": Shubman Gill's 'Nike' Moment Sparks Brand Visiblity Talks
content: India's thumping Test win at Edgbaston under new skipper Shubman Gill wasn't the only headline-grabber this week. The Indian captain's seemingly minor athleisure choice led to a major conversation online.

title: Jeffery Epstein's Guest List, Murder Theories Debunked By FBI In New Report
content: Convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein didn't keep a supposed "client list" to blackmail powerful figures, the US President Donald Trump's Department of Justice (DOJ) and FBI reportedly concluded in a memo on the disgraced financier's death probe.

title: Bengaluru Man Thrashed For Obscene Texts, Attackers Inspired By 'Darshan Case'
content: During the assault, one of the attackers referred to the Renukaswamy murder case, threatening the victim with similar consequences.

title: Man Kills Wife With Brick Over Phone Call In Gurugram, Arrested
content: A man allegedly killed his wife here by clobbering her head with a brick after he heard her speaking to someone on the phone. Police Sunday said he has been arrested and interrogated.

title: Ex Chief Justice Overstaying In Government Home, Top Court Writes To Centre
content: Noting that former Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud has overstayed in the Chief Justice's official residence, the Supreme Court administration has written to the Centre, urging it to ensure that the bungalow is vacated immediately

title: PM Modi Welcomes Indonesia As New Full Member Of BRICS Summit 2025
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi formally welcomed Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto into the BRICS grouping as a full member during the 17th BRICS Summit held in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

title: Chirag Paswan Declares He Will Contest All 243 Seats In Bihar Elections
content: Claiming that there was a "conspiracy" to thwart his foray into Bihar politics, Union minister Chirag Paswan on Sunday asserted that he would, nonetheless, contest the upcoming assembly polls in the state.

title: Vande Bharat Express Stranded For 7 Hours In Odisha As Rains Flood Tracks
content: Torrential rains in Odisha's Keonjhar district on Saturday brought life to a standstill and severely disrupted railway services, leaving hundreds of passengers stranded aboard the Vande Bharat Express for nearly seven hours.

title: At BRICS, PM Modi Calls For "Working Together For Responsible AI"
content: PM Modi stated that India views AI as a means to enhance human values and capabilities called for giving equal priority to resolving concerns and encouraging innovation in AI governance, and added that they need to work together for Responsible AI.

title: Man, 62, Duped Of Rs 73 Lakh In Gold Trading Fraud By Woman He Met Online
content: A 62-year-old resident of Navi Mumbai has allegedly been cheated of Rs 73.72 lakh after being lured into gold trading for high returns by a woman whom he met through a dating application, police said on Monday.

title: Siddaramaiah Clarifies After MLA's 'Development Or Guarantees' Remark
content: Siddaramaiah's economic adviser, Basavaraj Raya Reddy, on Saturday told a public rally to choose between election guarantees and development.

title: Union Minister Gadkari says World War could ‚Äòbreak out anytime‚Äô, flays superpowers‚Äô authoritarianism
content: The technological advancements pertaining to war were also making it tougher to protect humanity, he asserted.

title: Producers of hit film Manjummel Boys turn up for questioning before police in cheating case
content: Interrogation in connection with alleged denial of principal amount and profit share to an investor in the movie

title: Himachal rains: Rescue operations on to trace 30 missing after cloudbursts, landslips in Mandi
content: Since the onset of monsoon, Himachal Pradesh has reported 78 deaths, of which 50 were linked to rain-related incidents such as cloudbursts, flash floods and landslips

title: Clash during Muharram procession: Prohibitory Orders imposed in Jharkhand‚Äôs Palhe village
content: At least three persons were injured in the clash that took place in Palhe village in the Patan police station area on July 6

title: T.N. CM Stalin to visit Cuddalore on July 14
content: According to official sources, the Chief Minister will launch the first camp of the ‚ÄòUngaludan Stalin‚Äô (Stalin with you) initiative on July 15 in Chidambaram Municipality¬†

title: World Bank report: Congress terms government assertion on India being among ‚Äòmost equal‚Äô countries as ‚Äòfraudulent‚Äô
content: The Congress demanded that the Press Information Bureau must clarify as to the origins of this press release and retract it immediately

title: Suspicious boat spotted near Raigad Coast in Maharashtra, security stepped up
content: Prima facie, the vessel is suspected to bear markings of another country and may have drifted to the Raigad coast, an official said

title: Supreme Court to hear on July 10 pleas challenging Special Intensive Revision in Bihar
content: RJD MP Manoj Jha, TMC MP Mahua Moitra and activist Yogendra Yadavn were among the petitioners against the ECI‚Äôs Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in poll-bound Bihar

title: Attacks on Hindi-speaking people: BJP leader draws Pahalgam parallel to target Thackeray cousins
content: Last week, MNS workers damaged the glass door of Mumbai-based share market investor Sushil Kedia's office in Worli after he declared he would not speak Marathi

title: Thousands witness grand consecration of Tiruchendur Subramanya Swamy temple after 16 years

title: Twist in Pune techie 'rape' case: Complaint was false and misleading, say police

title: Over 8,600 pilgrims leave Jammu base camp for Amarnath Yatra in sixth batch
content: There is a huge rush at the counters for on-the-spot registration, with authorities increasing the number of counters as well as the daily quota to ease the rush

title: Kunwar Anand Singh, former MP and father of MoS Kirti Vardhan Singh, passes away
content: Kunwar Anand Singh was elected to the Uttar Pradesh Assembly in 1964, 1967, and 1969. He was elected to the Lok Sabha from Gonda in 1971, and again in 1980, 1984, and 1989

content: The Central Railway initially attributed the suspension to a "technical problem," but it was later confirmed that a track maintenance machine had derailed

content: Mr. Jaishankar, during his meeting with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov, discussed bilateral cooperation, West Asia, BRICS and the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO)

content: He pointed out that the day carried an emotional significance to the BJP, as it coincidentally marked the birth anniversary of Syama Prasad Mookerjee

content: Two camps will be held in each of the 200 wards from July 15 to October 31, with about 2,000 volunteers

content: L-G Sinha said Mookerjee sacrificed his life for unification of J&K with India and was a proponent of ‚ÄòOne Nation, One Constitution, One Symbol‚Äô and opposed Article 370

title: PM Modi meets Cuban President; discuss ties in pharma, UPI on sidelines of BRICS
content: The two leaders agreed to work on issues of concern to the global South, including in the areas of health, pandemics and climate change.

title: Study links air pollution to preterm births, low birth weight in India
content: The study has also found that Bihar, Haryana, Punjab, and Uttar Pradesh bear the brunt of the reproductive consequences of bad air

title: Bengaluru to get 4,500 electric buses under PM e-Drive scheme
content: The CESL tender, issued last month, aims to procure, operate, and maintain 10,900 electric buses across five major cities, with Bengaluru alone slated to receive the largest share

title: Lokesh lauds teachers for enrolling their children in government schools
content: Minister for Human Resources Development (HRD) Nara Lokesh on Sunday praised government schoolteachers, who are not only promoting public education but also enrolling their own children in government schools.

title: Congress alleges rigging in Haryana Assistant Professor recruitment exams; seeks re-conduct and judicial probe
content: Addressing the delegation of the candidates appearing for the Assistant Professor exam, former Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda said that ‚Äúpaper leaks, copy-paste exams and scams have become synonymous with the recruitments conducted under the BJP government‚Äù.

title: There should be no hesitation in imposing sanctions against terrorists: PM Modi at BRICS
content: "From West Asia to Europe, today the world is surrounded by disputes and tensions. The humanitarian situation in Gaza is a cause of great concern," he said.

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .
